alert.note: Alert for Burleson; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 1:22PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Burleson, southwestern Brazos and central Washington Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 122 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Caldwell, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brenham, Caldwell, Somerville, Snook, Burton, Lake Somerville Dam, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Carmine, Lyons, Deanville, Independence and Quarry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
